clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Interactions of Tasimelteon and Ethanol
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-mask, Four-period Crossover Study in Healthy Subjects to Evaluate the Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Interactions of Tasimelteon and Ethanol

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to understand if there is any difference in the effects of tasimelteon when it is taken alone or in combination with alcohol. This research study is also being done to understand if there is any difference in the amount of tasimelteon (and its breakdown products) or alcohol in the blood when taken alone or together. Finally, the study will also look at the safety and tolerability (how acceptable it is) of tasimelteon.

detailed_description.textblock: Alcohol is a drug that gets absorbed into the bloodstream quickly. The blood carries the alcohol to the brain where it slows down the messages in the brain (alcohol is a depressant). Alcohol affects a person's memory, behaviour, concentration, alertness (your thought process is slower), and coordination (your movements become clumsy). The intended effect of tasimelteon is to cause sleepiness. Sleepiness may result in similar effects on memory, concentration, alertness, and coordination as alcohol. There is the possibility taking tasimelteon and alcohol together can make these effects stronger or worse.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic parameters (Digit Vigilance, Digit Symbol Substitution Task, Hopkins Verbal Learning Test Revised , Divided Attention Test, Balance Platform Test, Choice Reaction Time, Visual Analog Scale) as measured by peak change from baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 8, 15, 22: at pre-dose, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours after dose
primary_outcome.description: Differences will be calculated for the following comparisons: Ethanol Alone vs. Placebo-Placebo Ethanol Alone vs. Tasimelteon + Ethanol Tasimelteon Alone vs. Placebo-Placebo Tasimelteon Alone vs. Tasimelteon + Ethanol

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters (AUC, Cmax, Tmax) of tasimelteon, tasimelteon's metabolites, and ethanol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately Days 1, 8, 15, and 22: predose, 0.25, 0.75, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours after dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability as measured by spontaneous reporting of AEs, and clinically significant changes in laboratory parameters, ECG parameters, and vital signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening (approximately Day -10), Days -2, -1, 1, and approximately Days 8, 15, 22, 23

secondary_outcome.measure: The Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale will be used to assess suicidal behavior and ideation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: once per day at Screening (approximately day -7),Day -1 (baseline), approximately Days 1, 8, 15, 22 and 23 (end of study)

clinical_study.condition: Pharmacodyamics and Pharmacokinetics of Tasimelteon Alone and in Combination With Ethanol

intervention.description: 0.6 g/kg ethanol (women) or 0.7 g/kg ethanol (men) in a total volume of 300 mL as a light cranberry juice cocktail, (consumed within 15 minutes).
A total volume of 300 mL as a light cranberry cocktail (consumed within 15 minutes) with about 1 mL of supernatant of ethanol in the top
